name: brand
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: brand
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a type of product made by a particular company

example.eg: This isn't my usual brand of deodorant.
example.egtrans: 这不是我通常用的那种牌子的除臭剂。

example.eg: When I go to a supermarket I usually buy own (US store) brands (= the cheaper products with the shop's own name on them).
example.egtrans: 我去超市时常常购买超市的自有品牌产品。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a particular type of something, or way of doing something

example.eg: a team that plays a distinctive brand of football
Do you like his brand of humour?

dsense.name: brand
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of burning wood used to give light

dsense.name: brand
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a mark that is burned or frozen into the skin of an animal such as a cow to show who owns it

example.eg: The brand was still visible on the animal's hide.
example.egtrans: 兽皮上还可以看见烙印。

name: brand
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: brand
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to say that you think someone is the sort of person that is stated

example.eg: Because of one minor offence he was branded (as) a common criminal.
example.egtrans: 由于一次小过错，他蒙上了罪犯的污名。

example.eg: The newspapers have branded the rebel MP a fool.
example.egtrans: 报纸谴责反叛的下院议员背信弃义。

dsense.name: brand
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to mark an animal such as a cow by burning or freezing its skin to show you own it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 打烙印于；以烙铁打（标记）

example.eg: The cattle were rounded up and branded.
example.egtrans: 那些牛都被圈了起来打上烙印。
